question.text: Which sentence correctly uses the phrase a lot of?

answers.answer: She learned a lot of programming languages.
He has a lot of careful in his work.
answers.feedback: The word careful is an adjective, not a noun. A lot of should be used with nouns.

answers.answer: I have a lot of idea for the new app.
answers.feedback: The countable noun idea should be in its plural form when used with the phrase a lot of.

answers.answer: She has a lot of the most experience in our team.
answers.feedback: When comparing qualities, more or most is appropriate, not a lot of.
